result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:29 AM Defendant Addison Bruce Klink-Schleifer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Addison Bruce Klink-Schleifer.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court examines Defendant as to waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court accepts the waiver, finding it to be free and voluntary, and binds the Defendant over for trial.  State files information.  Counsel acknowledges receipt of the information, waives reading, and enters not guilty pleas.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:34AM .  Defendant Addison Bruce Klink-Schleifer appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case to be recalled. 

 
10:00am Case not recalled as the Court spoke with Atty Heather Dvoran and provided copy of complaint. Atty Dvoran will indicate defendant later today so court set next hearing date for 9/28/22 at 10am and advised Corp Gahan who will advise the defendant.
Status hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Status hearing on September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.

1:28 PM Defendant Addison Bruce Klink-Schleifer appeared by video, in custody at Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Addison Bruce Klink-Schleifer.  Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading. Counsel advises Defendant will be retaining an Attorney. Court finds probable cause. State requesting $750 cash bail with conditions. State advises Defendant is on a probation hold. Court finds good cause to extend any time limits and set case for status on prelim.
Status hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
